Reviews.Title: “Good Find.”
Reviews.Author: Elaine627
Reviews.Content: Galileo is a 10 min walk from Termini station and 5 min from Castro Pretorio metro. Reception is bright and staff pleasant. We had Room 304, it was a good size, king sized bed, hanging space, tv, safe and a beautifully tiled shower room. Everything was spotless. The small balcony overlooked rooftops. Breakfast was a good selection of cereals, bread and pastries, yogurts, fruits and cheeses and unlimited tea, coffee and fruit juices. Galileo is a great base, we walked to most of the sights but got the metro home in the evening. It costs 1 euro for anywhere in the city. It's not perfect, a loose light-fitting, a small cigarette burn on the bed cover (no smell of smoke anywhere in the building) but I'd recommend this hotel and would certainly stay again when we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the hotel and the location.”
Reviews.Author: PaulineSJ
Reviews.Content: On arriving in Rome by train, Hotel Galileo is very easy to find using their excellent website directions. We walked to the hotel from the station in less than ten minutes. Our room on the second floor was very clean with plenty of space and appeared to be recently redecorated. The bed was comfortable and the neighbourhood was quiet. The bathroom was quite roomy with a nice large shelf under the window. Unfortunately the doors on the usual miniscule Italian shower had a tendency to leave the track and swing loose. When we checked in we were sure we were told breakfast would be at 7.00, but the day we wanted to eat early to leave on a tour it didn't start until 7.30 and we were only able to grab a quick snack. Breakfast itself was quite good with a range of cold cuts and pastries. The reception staff were helpful and spoke excellent English. Overall we were very happy with this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: TeamTam
Reviews.Content: Hotel Galieo is about a 15 minute walk with luggage from the main train station in Rome, but is about 20 metres back from the street down a long driveway so it is a little confusing to find at first. The room was clean, heating was good and bed was fine ... the positives ended there for us unfortunately. The shower was lukewarm at best, and when reception was notified we were told it was because other hotel guests might be using the hot water at the time. Even if this were so, surely this would mean it's an inadequate plumbing system for a hotel? We tried the shower at several times both in the morning and evening during the course of our stay, and it was the same every time. Also, the shower door in our room was broken so water splashed everywhere when using the shower. There was an electronic safe that was not connected and so could not be used, and we were also hoping for a kettle that wasn't there. Breakfast was very limited, and only begins at 7:30am so you will miss it if you have an early tour such as to Naples/Pompeii as we did. Also, if you get to the breakfast after 9am, your options may be limited - all the pastries were gone when we had a late breakfast one morning and they weren't replenished. When I asked about wifi, reception informed me that it was only available in the breakfast room at a cost of 5 Euro for 24 hours of usage. Luckily, our room had some (limited) wifi coverage to make it worth our while, otherwise I don't see how it can worthwhile to use in the breakfast room that is often locked. And in general, while the service wasn't outrightly bad, the staff didn't seem eager to help ... there was nobody to help with luggage upon checking in/out, and nobody to seat you at breakfast etc. It wasn't the worst hotel experience we ever had so that we would cut our stay short, but we won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - good location & fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: B3XDX
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at Hotel Galileo for three nights starting Boxing Day this year. The location is brilliant. Like other reviews have said, just a short walk from Termini station and we even found we were able to walk to all major sites such as the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain etc too. The only time we needed to get transport was when visiting the Vatican. However, this was not a problem at all. The area the hotel is located in was great also, right in the city but no noise!! The hotel itself was lovely - exactly what you need. Yes, our room was slightly on the small side but our large en suite made up for this. The rooms were extremely clean and had excellent facilities. Continental breakfast is served in a large breakfast room which leads outside. Breakfast was lovely! However, the best part of this hotel was by far the staff. Always there to greet you with a massive smile, they were more than happy to go out of their way to help you with whatever you needed. The even went as far as arranging for the owner of a local restaurant we were planning on eating at to pick us up & drop us off. They were an absolute delight! One final note is regarding the tax. Some have complained about this & I'd just like to state that this has nothing to do with the hotel. Tax is paid at a rate of €2 per night for each tourist staying in Rome city. This was clearly outlined to us when booking and was also stated on the notice board within the hotel itself. A great time was had at Galileo & I'd definitely recommend. I'll also definitely be staying here on my next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: MianPaulo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days it's located near Castro Petrorio Station or 5-10 mins walk to Termini and 10-15 mins walk to Republika. The hotel was clean and neat and the breakfast is good. There's also a Pinoy restaurant closeby "Pinoy Fast Food" where we used to eat for dinner. Location is perfectly safe since on the corner there's always a military personnel probably guarding the embassies. Also the check-in time is after 1:30pm, but they're kind enough to store our belongings and we went out for a stroll. Pros: Great value for money, location (with small children it's better if the station is close by), Breakfast is good. Room is clean and neat. Staff are always smiling and helpful. Cons: The partition between rooms is not sound proof, so you can hear ppl from other room. Shower area is small, if you're fat you're probably not going to fit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: KiwiHJC
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed in this hotel a couple of weeks back at the end of a 2 week trip in Italy. Good location 10 min walk to the Termini station & only a few to a local metro. Easy to get to all the sites in Rome. Great sized twin room at the end of a corridor. Have to say that Florin on reception was fantastic, always welcoming and he was very helpful when requested to find me a gluten free restaurant in the city. (There a 3 for those that wish to know. Also an amazing Farmarcia with a whole floor of gluten free products to buy on the corner near the Hotel). The housekeeper on our floor always greeted us with a huge smile when we saw her. Overall would highly recommend this Hotel & would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: debbyspero
Reviews.Content: just came back from a fab trip to rome. stayed at this hotel for 5 nites. excellent location- 10 min walk from termini station, banks and stores right near by. hotel was in a very nice area. we came back at midnite sometimes and always felt perfectly safe. staff was very pleasant. rooms were very clean. bed was very comfortable. breakfast was lovely, tho it only started at 7:30- a bit late for those who like to get an early start. price was reasonable. rooms were a bit small but sufficient. not too much closet/shelf space for unpacking. no shelf or counter in the bathroom, which was a little inconvenient. floor is not too comfortable to stand on- some kind of vinyl covering over cement. but all in all, i would most definitely stay there again and would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ranz-nz
Reviews.Content: Nice sized twin room, great central location, easy to get around, close to the train station. Buffet breakfast to start the day and fantastic staff ready with a map, directions and information to make your stay in Rome as stress free as possible. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this Hotel, Great stay !!”
Reviews.Author: sylik_007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 9 hotels which were all 3 stars across Europe. This review is based on the fact it is a 3 star hotel. Out of all the hotels we stayed in only one 3 star hotel was better than this one, and that was the hotel Kyriad at Disneyland Paris. Any hotel around Disneyland i would expect superior excellence so Hotel Galileo was a clear standout amongst the others. Pros: Extremely helpful and welcoming staff. We were greeted with maps and advice and they had already helped confirm our pick up service before we asked them. This was easily the best experience from a staff point of view of all the hotels we stayed in. The room was modern, spacious and clean. The bathroom as as good as the other hotels ( bath and shower combined ). The breakfast spread was good. The room had air conditioning that worked well. The room was great and the staff made this clearly the best experience of the 3 star hotels we experience. The Disneyland hotel which was 3 stars only was better in the buffet breakfast and space point of view ( had plenty of space ). Close to Termini Station which is the Central train line in getting to and from Rome. It is also where many of the Tourist bus's operate from. Cons: None. Perhaps if trying to find the hotel on your own, then it might be slightly tricky. The hotels entrance is just off the street on the driveway that leads to its carpark. There are signs leading the way however might be missed by someone expecting the door on the front of the street. We would hesitate in returning here if we venture to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “"Home from home"”
Reviews.Author: meddy65
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Galileo are so warm and friendly you feel very relaxed early in your stay here. Our visit was in Aug 2011 the weather was 38c everyday so coming back to our room after a long day seeing the sights of Rome was just bliss!! AC in the room worked so well, bathroom large with excellent shower. The room has a mini bar so we brought our own drink from the supermarket (3 mins away, right out of hotel, first left, supermarket is on your left) breakfast was fine, you could have in on their room terrace. There is a metro station 5 mins away or Termmi station which is the main line and metro 10 mins away. There are restaurants all around the hotel but you could be in the center of Rome from the hotel in 20 mins max. I would stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shivakumar1975
Reviews.Content: The double room was excellent. The lights, colour were too good. The bathroom was pretty big and clean. The balcony opening to the sky was awesome. I will definitely want to come back. But the Internet was not working and that was a bit disapponting.

Reviews.Title: “awesome experience....”
Reviews.Author: salma100
Reviews.Content: Ambience & the Decor of the Room excellent!!!! Washrooms extremely clean.....The first place in Europe where i saw a bidett (health Faucet)!!!!!! Staff very helpful and accomodative..break fast extremely good.....even after check out we could keep our baggage and come back to freshen-up and catch the train.........

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: EvaaaaaScotland
Reviews.Content: We were given a room with a balcony which was really nice and the room was bigger than expected. We couldn't believe how quiet it was but as the hotel is set back from the road (which isn't a busy one anyway), it was really peaceful. The bed was big and comfortable and we both (light sleepers) slept really well. It was a 5 minute walk from the Metro which is really cheap and quick to use, so easy to get to all the sites. We were able to walk from Termini station to the hotel in about 15 minutes with a case. Don't take a taxi if you can help it - we were quoted 28 Euros! We were recommended a restaurant at Number 46 in the same street which was really good and you get a 20% discount if you let them know that you are staying at the Galileo. The staff were all very friendly, apart from the manager who could maybe take some lesons from his staff! In particular, the gentleman on reception (the one with glasses - sorry, forgot to ask his name!) was lovely, interesting and very helpful. Breakfast was average but plenty of it. Only locals seem to be given the "real" cappuccinos, the rest of us had to make do with a coffee machine, which was a bit disappointing. Overall, we were happy with the hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel too far away from the action of Rome”
Reviews.Author: happyholidayhaven
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, but nothing special. It had the tiniest bathroom and strange shower which flooded the bathroom every time you used it. The area it was in felt quite safe, but there wasn't much near it so we really had to search for somewhere to eat. And it was too far out of the way to be able to take our little one back in the afternoon for a nap. The breakfast was very average not much to choose from-make sure the male manager makes your cappucino, the female waitress is lovely but makes a horrible one! We were charged to use the internet (something most other places we stayed at did not charge for). There is a couple of supermarkets close by for supplies. But overall this is nothing special just too far out of the main city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: elenaciabuca
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Galileo Hotel for 3 nights in March and had a wonderful time .The staff is very firendly, the room was ok, new furniture , very clean and the breakfast was very good .I would definetly recommend this hotel for those who want to visit Rome and pay a reasonable price for accomodation.The metro station is at 5 minutes away and in the area you will find a couple of restaurants where you can have a meal at a good price and also a discount for staying at this hotel.Very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull city, very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RotterdamHolland
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for sight-seeing and it was great. We had excellent weather, very nice hotel near the central station Termini. We walked to the station and then took bus 64, wich crosses the whole town, final destination the Vatican and in between you could go out and walk to all the other highlights of Rome. Nice hotel, nice people and very helpfull receptionist, i would defenitly go back cause of the good rates they have, Sandra the Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: anutza1985
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome for the first time in January 2011 (more exactly 18-21 January) and I choose Galileo Hotel for accommodation. The hotel was very very clean, the reception staff very friendly and attentive, the maid the same (Elena, third floor). I am sorry that I forgot the romanian front desk boy name but he was lovely. Breakfast was good but the coffee was terrible. Try this hotel, we will not be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel with reasonable prize”
Reviews.Author: Tammilaakso
Reviews.Content: We expected something less fancy, as the prize was so reasonable, but we discovered high quality small family hotel. Staff was friendly and hotel was clean, beds were nice and the towels were white and soft. And we even had a small balcony! Very charming! Breakfast was small, but as I said, what can you expect if you are budget traveller. It was included and staff was smily and coffee was fresh and there was plenty of choises anyway. Metro was near, railwaystation was near, so the location was perfect. Pieni perhehotelli. Meitä oltiin varoiteltu, että edulliset hotellit ovat hyvin vaatimattomia, mutta hotelli olikin viihtyisä ja hiljainen, sängyt hyvät ja kylpyhuone laadukas. Pyyhkeet olivat paksuja froteisia ja vitivalkoisia ja shamppoota ja saippuaa täydennettiin kolmen päivän matkamme aikana. Menemme uudestaankin ja suosittelemme muillekin. Rautatieasema lentokentälle oli ihan kulman takana ja metropysäkki ihan vieressä. Todella helppo kulkea katselemaan nähtävyyksiä.

Reviews.Title: “High standard accomodation”
Reviews.Author: IanV
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, and were quite impressed. The staff were certainly friendly and check in was trouble free, including the compulsory form to register foreigners with the local Police. The hotel may provide a wifi service, but there may be a cost. The room was small but acceptable, and the beds were nice and firm. Clean bedding and immaculate bright decor - including the bathroom - made for a great room. Sadly, there was no tea/coffee making facility which would have made a perfect room. Rooms and corridors were carpeted which reduced noise from other guests. Continental breakfast was varied and included cereal (budget branding I fear), bread, yoghurts, fruit (prunes etc), pastries, nutella spread, meats and cheeses. The coffee machine made warm coffees, but they were tasty! Rooms 106, 107 and 108 back out onto the small courtyard so be aware if you don't like the smokers! Location - 5-10 mins walk from Termini. Don't panic by jumping in the first taxi. It really is easy to walk to. And to gain access, you have to walk up a driveway which you think is for the carpark....it is, but the entrance is on the left. Being near the metro means you can move quickly to the sites. Use the S.I.T bus shuttle service on the Via Marsala to get back to the airport - 8 euros each. Research affordable restaurants before you go. Pricing is extortionate in Rome for what you get. There are McDonalds abound if you're desperate and can get a Big Mac meal for 6.50. There's a Hard Rock Cafe at the Via Vittorio Veneto, near the Spagna metro station if you fancy a hearty burger and fries for 15 euros!! Americano coffees are only 2 euros though! The La Cucina Nazionale restaurant on Via Nazionale also provides affordable offers. A supermarket was nearby too though it was expensive compared with UK stores. But you can still pick up a large bottle of fizzy drink/soda for 1 euro. In conclusion, a well specified hotel in a great location, but make sure you know where to eat and drink cheaply!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: HajjiBaba1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through AAA. It was rate as a 3 1/2 star. We were highly impressed by the cleanliness and reasonabe size of the room and hotel overall. We had a triple room, which overlooked a courtyard. Vey charming. The beds were firm and the bathroom very very nice. It is a smaller sized hotel, with no "fluff" and it is within walking distance to the metro and several sites. The staff was very friendly, except one of the night watch gentlemen. The continental breakfast was classic, very tasty and there was a nice variety of food to choose. We would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, comfortable, reliable”
Reviews.Author: PeakinDarien
Reviews.Content: Excellent location close to Termini. Two good restaurants nearby Grotta d'Azzuro and Leoni d'Abruzzo. The hotel is super clean with modern bathrooms. The bedrooms are not big but hey this is Europe and the hotel was not expensive (I got a special deal from my travel agent in Australia). In the morning you get a good solid breakfast in a nice airy dining room. Strangely enough since this is Rome, the coffee was bad so I stuck to tea. The staff were very polite and helpful. The only downer for me was that there was no ironing facility in the room..

Reviews.Title: “Maybe ***-Starquality - but that's all.”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy95
Reviews.Content: Attracted by the good reviews I chose Galileo as well, but who these reviews wrote I don't know-I felt the hotel was somewhat disappointing. Room I had (309) was excellent and pretty decorated with a very nice looking bathroom - however quite tiny without possibility to store your bathroomitems. Breakfast was very poor; only 1 kind of (stale) bread, fruits from a can, juice that was limonade - no more than 2-star quality. Internetpoint in lobby way to expensive - 3 euro for only half hour and a slow connection which had trouble working - should have been 1 euro at the most, just like another internetcafé just around the corner. The 2 young receptionistguys I met where very kind and trying hard to be of good service - the other older guy should go on a course for at least better English and some more servicetraining. Maybe he did the best he could-I will never go. It's a 10 minute walk from Termini only if you can walk very fast.... Altogether it was not noisy and quiet indeed. It's a okay hotel for those who failed to find a better one.

Reviews.Title: “rome italy in july”
Reviews.Author: cazbarLancashire
Reviews.Content: My grandaughter and I have just returned from Rome staying 4 nights at the Hotel Galileo.The hotel was very conveniant for the bus and metro station,only about 10min walk away.We found the staff very helpfull and friendly.The room could have been a bit brighter and larger,but we weren't in it much.They recommended a restaurant a few minutes away called Taverna Pretoriana,we found the food excellent and reasonable priced.(plenty of choice even for teenagers) Being July it was very busy and hot (but it was the only time we could go).The 'hop on hop off 'city tour bus was a good way to see the sights.If you go to the Vatican City pay the extra for a tour because the queues were miles long.Do not eat anywhere near or you will get ripped off. There is an information bureau at the bus station and staff are helpfull about tours and local buses.

Reviews.Title: “perfecto”
Reviews.Author: ticinogirl
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the hotel with my two teenagers and we had a wonderful time. The personal were extremely friendly and very helpful. The rooms are small but comfortable and very clean, the beds were excellent, and the bathroom was new, and very clean. Breakfast was fine. The location is excellent, quite at night yet very near the Termini train station. I higly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff - best location - great price”
Reviews.Author: Adiddles
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed 6 days. The room was small, but we only used it to sleep and shower. Very clean and cleaned everyday. The safe was a bonus. Breakfast went for a few hours, so there was no need to rush. The staff were fantastic!! They had great tourist maps and the best ideas on where to go. It is not classy but friendly and personal. My daughter became suddenly ill (through no fault of the hotel at all) and they were so helpful, translating to the ambulance drivers and caring and helpful on our return. Being a mother and daughter travelling it was comforting to know they noticed when we left the hotel and returned, and ensured our safety if we ventured out at night. I cannot express how fantastic I found the staff. Yes, the elevator was small, like two people only small, but the staff took care of getting your luggage to and from your room, so really no problem. The location was excellent. If you have a suitcase with wheels I would recommend you walk from Termoni station, it is easily done. The cab drivers took us for an expensive ride when we arrived, we soon worked out we could have done it with a 5 to 10 minute walk. I was a bit worried about the entrance, but is is very well lit, we were rarely back before dark. Helpful hint, laundrymat is just two blocks to the right, reasonably priced with internet access while you wait. Lots of little local restaurants, try the local lasagne's and pastas, just great!! I will be staying there again when return!!

Reviews.Title: “Price / Quality perfect!”
Reviews.Author: El_Fregadero
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel for a 10 day trip in Rome in July / August. We do think it is a very nice hotel, suited about 10 minutes walk from the central station of Rome (Termini) from where all trains, busses and metro's start / stop. The hotel itself is just great. Nice rooms which kept very clean. The beds are perfect if you like hard beds. My girlfriend and I just slept perfectley on these beds (we wished we had them at our home!). There is also a TV in the room, but it has mainly italian channels. The bathroom is just perfect. Nicely decorated and above all very functional. We liked the shower, but that's just personal. Service is good, the staf does always want to help you if you ask. They may seem a bit cold at the beginning, but if you try to speak a few word Italian they melt like a icecream in the (Roman) sun. The front desk helped us adequate on every question we asked. They were mostly doing their job with a smile. Ask them for tips to eat, they know the local hot spots and they are willing to share their knowledge with you if you ask. The breakfast is not abundant, but very good and tasty. Even my girlfriend liked it very much and she is a bit of a picky eater. Conclusion is that if we return in Rome (I'm planning to, but i'm not sure my girlfriend want to see it all again) we definitely will be returning at this hotel!. The price / quality is just perfect and I'm wondering if there's any hotel in Rome who can beat this ratio!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location, good rooms, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Oz_Voyage
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in November 2009 and were plesantly surprised at how nice the rooms were, freshly renovated, own bathroom and a large bed! Also the location was excellent, apart from being 10 min lazy walk from Termini it was also in the Embassy area so it felt a lot safer. We did find the service very disappointing though, the gentleman at the front desk would only recommend restaurants that the hotel had a "deal" with (and since this was only one restaturant we just went by chance), and he also refused to ring the airport shuttle for us as the hotel had a deal with a private car company (which was much more expensive). It was just many little things like this that left us disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient; great value for money”
Reviews.Author: googlecat
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most pleasant budget hotels I've stayed in. The location is great for Termini railway and metro stations and is full of little restuarants and bars. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was very clean, although it was small. The bathroom was also lovely and clean, and spacious considering the room size. Breakfast was ok - no better or worse than any other Italian hotel I've stayed in, and was served in a lovely bright room. There is a little terrace to relax on next to it. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Hotell Galileo Rome”
Reviews.Author: LeFet
Reviews.Content: This is a small budget hotel. It is very clean, has a buffet breakfast that will keep you going for most of the day. It is very close to the main transport system easy to get to from the airport. The front desk staff are very helpful. While the room's are small and basic it was ideal for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Galileo Hotel - Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: davebevmc
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the staff were so friendly and helpful. Giving invaluable travel / sightseeing advice that made our stay so much easier. (When you know how to get around a strange city to see the things you want, it makes it so much more pleasureable). A small but friendly / personal Hotel. The room was large enough and immaculatly clean. There was a short problem with the water, but this was quickly resolved and compensated with a bottle of champagne. Breakfast was served over 3 hours so there was no mad rush in the morning. Rooms and en-suite were cleaned everyday. Location is 10 mins walk to Termini - fantastic for all bus, Metro & rail links. Overall a wonderful 4 days made better by the can do attitude of the staff - hope they read this and realise what a great service they provide. If we go to Rome again I will look no further than The Galileo Hotel for our stay. Dave & Bev McBride

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: AndesRuby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December '04, having been secured a room by an airport travel agent once our plane landed. The hotel is nothing luxurious, but it's comfortable for a short stay. The clerk spoke English. Breakfast was free every morning (bread, jam, cheese, cold meats, coffee, juice, etc.). The room was small but clean and had a safe inside the wardrobe. There is a VERY small elevator (can fit two people at a time or so), but the bellhops are nice enough to carry your bags up the steps if the elevator is full. Perhaps the best aspects of this hotel were the price and the location; the price is reasonable considering that your'e in Europe and so central to the train station. The station is only about a 10-minute walk, and other sites of interest are very close-by. (There are some Roman baths being excavated, for instance, on the way to the train station within about a five-minute walk from the hotel.) What I didn't like about the place is that it was rather dark and outdated-looking, and the bathrooms were poorly designed. Plus, if you're not used to washing with a detachable showerhead, you just might need to shower with help or the bathroom will be flooded! All in all, I would stay here again if I had to, but if I could find another clean place for a similar price, I'd probably check out something else. If you're out of options though, or are just looking to save on lodging to use your money on other things during the trip, this isn't a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Locations”
Reviews.Author: Kelly1639
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for two nights and found it to be clean and convenient to the major sights. About two blocks down on the same side of the street was a wonderful little restaurant I would highly recommend. I would stay here again given the price, or you could pay three times as much and get the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Fab45
Reviews.Content: We had three days at this hotel in Oct 2006. Yes, the room was small, but the accomodation was very comfortable, with everything clean and tidy. It is a typical 3 star hotel in Rome, and I would recommend it as such. The staff were extremely helpful with info for tourists, and the location of the hotel was quiet, yet very convenient to rail and bus transport. Two typically Italian restaurants were avail within the same block, and the food was excellent, and the prices great. A pharmacia, and supermarket were within 5 mins walk. Overall, an excellent, well priced place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “not too bad”
Reviews.Author: ikkuh
Reviews.Content: I don't get all the other people that complain about this hotel: they must be little princes and princesses who expect 5 star service for only 2 star price. If you are not as spoiled as most of these respondents below, you will find this hotel a good deal for it's reasonable price. The room is small, but hey: you're in Rome! You don't need to stay in your room all day! I do have to admit that the bed is a little short (my boyfriend is almost 2 meters tall and was kind of sticking out of it). But the room and the bathroom are clean, airconditioned and not noisy at all. The breakfast is pretty good for Roman standard: The Romans themselves don't eat a lot of breakfast anyway (just some coffee and maybe a croissant). Overall, I think that if you are not spoiled and do not demand luxury on you trip to Rome, this is a good place at an excellent location for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights in this Hotel in June, 2006. We were booked into the hotel by our travel agency in Holand where we live. The reviews of the hotel were enough to scare us off, but we had already paid for the Hotel and there was little we could do. Overall the Hotel was not that nice, but not nearly as bad as we had feared. The rooms were small, and the bathroom very foolishly laid out. The toilet was next to the wall, and in front of the sink, so that if you bent over, you hit your head on the sink. You had to sit sideways on the toilet when you used it. We had the breakfast included at the hotel, but it was so bad that we skipped it two of the four days we were there. The "coffee" they served was shockingly bad. Imagine . . . really bad coffee in Italy. What a dissapointment. The outdoor seating area that they feature prominently in their brochure was closed for renovations and we ate our breakfast in their very cheesey dining room. Our bed was very bad, and we had to put the mattress on the floor in order to sleep - this worked out well for us, but was a pain in the neck to do every evening. The Hotel staff was helpful but not overly friendly - we didn't feel that we were made to feel welcome. If we could have changed our hotel, we would have. One good thing about this hotel was its location. A few minutes walk from the nearest Metro stop, and about a 10 minute walk from the "terminus" or central bus/metro station. This made getting around Rome fairly easy. There were probably 20 hotels within a five minute walk of our hotel, all of them pretty much the same style. There were a few nice ones but they were very pricy. If you are spending a lot of money on a trip to Rome, it would be a shame to have to stay in a mediocre hotel such as this one. Bite the bullett and stay at a Hilton. Overall, I would suggest you avoid this hotel, but if you have already paid and can't cancel, it is a tolorable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: bergenman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one week at this awful hotel. First thing we tried after booking in, and had a look at the room, was to cancel. But that was not possible, we had to pay for the whole week anyway. We seriously considered to checkout immediately and find another hotel. Unfortunately we didnt, and that partially ruined our summer holiday. The room was VERY tiny and hadnt been upgraded for decades, probably never ever. The walls where so thin that you could easily conversate with the neighbour rooms. Very noisy ear condition what either was fully on or off. We had to turn if on/off several times each night, but at least it was functioning. The matress felt some 40 years old. The staff was unhelpful and unfriendly. The breakfast was discusting, the eggs was boiled for one hour?? Those people that manages this hotel has ruined many peoples stay in Rome. You should have seen the expression in the faces of people arriving at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Termini, but not recommended”
Reviews.Author: tofumonsterz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night in October 2004. The entrance to the front desk was dark and gloomy. The front desk receptionist, efficient but unfriendly. The room was VERY small, 1 very lumpy mattress, 1 very hard mattress. The room was clean,except for 1 of the (face) towels was stained. We paid 150 Euros and if I was not so tired, would have walked out and found another hotel. We checked out too early for breakfast but the receptionist in the morning was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet spot close to Termini, sadly not clean, not well managed”
Reviews.Author: pastry.chef
Reviews.Content: Quiet, safe but run down property managed sloppily. We stayed three nights October 2004 with two teenagers. We chose this hotel since it was somewhat close (ten minute walk) to Termini yet in a nice quiet street of banks, consulates and residences. Also the price, 140 euros per night, seemed a good value for location. Turkish consulate is just down the street with 24 hour police guards, so you can bet this street is free of pickpockets and homeless immigrants which are a problem elsewhere in the Termini neighborhood. Although I had made reservations well in advance (two months earlier) the rooms were not ready when we arrived and we did not get adjacent rooms as we had requested. The hotel Galileo is set back from the street in the center of a block surrounded by other buildings. All of the rooms are quiet and we had no trouble sleeping due to noise. Comfort was not the best, cleanliness spotty. The beds were old and mattresses sagged. Lots of dust everywhere. The shower had some mildew and drained too slowly. Toilet flushed with difficulty. The facility is generally tired and worn down, little things broken or missing (nobs on drawers, lamps not working). We woke up early one morning to go to Vatican city and breakfast crew arrived late--supposed to serve at 7 am and we had to wait a half hour. There was a lot of yelling and crabby waitress tossed our bread basket on the table without apology. Obvious management problems, and staff not happy. Even though the weather was nice, they didn't want to serve us on the roof terrace since it was too much work. I would not return to this hotel unless I had to--better value is certainly to be had elsewhere. I would not recommend this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck! What a dump.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was the smallest room I have ever seen in my entire life. The matress was at least 25 years old and was extremely uncomfortable. The breakfast was also the shabbiest I have ever seen in Europe. Finally the staff was courteous, but not helpful in the least. Even with the easiest of questions. The only good thing about the hotel was that the air conditioning worked and the linens were clean.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Galileo
HotelInfo.Address: Via Palestro 33, 00185 Rome, Italy
